= Introduction =

This page describes how to add jSCEP to your own application.

= Details =

== Dependencies ==

jSCEP uses the [http://www.bouncycastle.org/ Bouncy Castle] JCE Provider library ("bcprov") for:

  * Generating X.509 Certificates
  * Generating [http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2314 PKCS #10] Certificate Signing Requests
  * Generating and Parsing ASN.1 Data


This library can be downloaded from the [http://www.bouncycastle.org/latest_releases.html latest releases] page on the Bouncy Castle web site.

== Using jSCEP ==

Using jSCEP is *easy*:

  * download the [http://code.google.com/p/jscep/downloads/list?q=label:Featured%20type=Library the latest release] of jSCEP
  * add the jSCEP and bcprov.jar to your classpath

See SecurityManagerRequirements

== Logging ==

jSCEP uses the Java Logging API for logging and has quite extensive log messages.
